justification-for-inclusion: It was effectively assumed that the surface has an emissivity of 1.0 so people could use the all-sky upwelling flux. This is not the case for modern climate models which use emissivities < 1.0 which results in local differences of several W/m^2. This affects the ability to compute clear-sky surface budgets and cloud radiative effect.
name: rluscs
title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation Clear Sky

review.atmosphere-review-comments-copy: Variable naming matches existing clear sky terms. Should be accepted.
